title: Love this
content: I rarely write reviews.  Only when a product stinks, or is extraordinary.  In this case, extra extraordinary.  I had rough patches on my cheeks for almost two years, and I was using PCA products, but obviously the wrong ones.  I'm 62.  This could have been due to stresses or hormone imbalances, so I finally I saw a friend of mine who is an esthetician, and all she did was rub the same products I was using into my face and wipe them off - for an HOUR.  So I started researching PCA products, and tried this one.  Why?  Because she told me Niacinimide was essential to healthy skin.  Within two days of use, my skin was noticeably better and after two weeks, I love my face again.  I use it with Hydrator Plus Broad Spectrum SPF 30, which was recommended, and the cost is so worth it!  You only use a tiny one-pump to cover your entire face, so it does last long.  Cost?  Your face is the first thing people see.  Wouldn't you want to have glowing skin again?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2019

title: Worth every penny!
content: This product is seriously addicting. I use several products from the PCA SKIN line, but this product is a must. I believe it is suitable for all skin types, considering I use it and so does my mother-in-law. I have oily skin with occasional flaking, and this product has solved my issue with flakiness. My skin always looks and feels smooth and supple now. I started out using it twice daily but have backed off to once daily use, and I feel like I am still getting the same results. Also keep in mind, a little bit goes a long way! Not even a full pump is needed to cover your entire face.

title: A pump problem ?
content: This may sound odd but I too experienced the product running out too soon. I decided to investigate. I screwed off the top which came loose but would not come off. I pulled on it and it started to give way. The top was attached to a bag of product. I really had to work to pull the whole bag out. The bag wasn't empty but the pump wasn't pulling the product out. I was able to finally use every bit by squeezing the bag and pumping at the same time -- a little tricky but doable. I'm presuming there is a delivery problem with some of the pumps.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2017
